p: Although micronutrients are safe compounds with important preventive and co-therapeutic activity for the treatment of many viruses, potentially including SARS-CoV-2, it should be considered that these molecules act on our biological system, and therefore, it is important to take food supplements in the correct doses, following expert advice, and only when it is necessary. It has been widely demonstrated that excessive doses of vitamins, mainly lipophilic ones, or minerals can provoke side effects that are harmful to human health. As confirmed by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO), the main preventive strategy against COVID-19 disease is the consumption of a healthy and balanced diet [ 107], whereas the use of supplements should be recommended only when really necessary.
